frontmatter.title: Improve async network state handling with custom React Hooks
frontmatter.description: In this article, I’ll cover the various states that network requests exist in and show you how to keep request management within custom Hooks. I’ll also walk you through building a small app that employs these Hooks.

frontmatter.title: Build a React Multi step Wizard with Formik and React Query
frontmatter.description: Multi step wizards are a solution allowing complex challenges to be broken down to a list of steps needed to accomplish a goal. Sometimes branching conditional logic is used to narrow the path to be taken by the user..

frontmatter.title: Pt 7: Build a CSS-in-JS React App with Styled Components and Priceline Design System
frontmatter.description: We will learn how to build a feature that progressively displays author information upon interaction. In the course of building this feature, we will learn techniques such as rate limiting using `debounce` and `lodash` and cache memoization to avoid memory leaks and improve performance.

frontmatter.title: Pt 6: Build a CSS-in-JS React App with Styled Components and Priceline Design System
frontmatter.description: Last time around we explored the use of infinite scrolling techniques to improve perceived responsiveness. Today, we will explore skeletal content placeholder screens as a technique for improving perceived app response times. We will also look at action notifications as an effective feedback mechanism.
